document_data.name: Undersong
document_data.mainbody: '''''Undersong''''' was a [[bard]]ic [[transmutation]] [[spell]] that conjured a soothing and familiar tune within the mind of the caster.
document_data.Effects: As long as the bard kept this song in their head, and hummed along with the melody, they experienced a sensation of focused concentration. Its effects lasted for a matter of minutes, depending on their experience and skill as a performer.
document_data.Components: This spell only required [[Verbal component|verbal]] utterances to cast.
document_data.History: Tvash-Prull developed spells for bards. In his one and only [[Tvash-Prull's symphony|symphony]] he magically embedded this and other spells in the sheet music for it to be discovered by bardic spellcasters who had the ability to detect and decipher the spells.{{Cite dragon/328/Tvash-Prull's Symphony|71}}
